Hello.

We noticed that there was an »error« in the calculation of the annual allocations.
According to the rules, the fixed percent of equal heating surfaces should be the same, but in some buildings this is not the case.



I'm also sending file from last year where the shares are the same.

Was there some error in settings and with all the update with WB made some changes? We've noticed this in some of the annual buildings, monthly are ok.
I am sending the entire file so that it can be checked.

Saša Šega

We will need to be able to support residents reported via Housing Service without an occupation date (start/end).

We will need to be able to support moves reported via Housing Service where the previous existing resident in the location does not have an occupation date.

We will need to be able to interpret/assume it's the first resident.

E.g. in relation to moves reported from Lemvig/Evita where none of the existing residents have an occupation date.

Currently Housing Service is only able to set/used on buildings with operation status "I" and "B" we will need for it to be possible to support "K" as well.

The "issue" has been identified as a part of the integration with Lemvig/Evita, where they'll do the final allocation themselves.

Let me know if any questions.

Input

  • SystemNo
  • Usage (list)
  • Start and end date (if null, return latest)
  • Advanced / not advanced, e.g. addresses, resident info (metadata or not - we have to do the same as with the individual readings (AGI-16419)

Same as 'get readings by meter' but for all meters in the system.

As a user, I want a detailed view on data from all individual measuring points, so that I can easily see my meter readings over time.

Additional Information

Link to wireframe web: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata?node-id=417-2647&t=3psGuzY2TzDWbNvk-4

Link to wireframe app: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata?node-id=345-2070&t=1DHk6KTesrlXhsqs-4

Note: PREVIOUS: Devices (EN) NOW: 'Readings' (EN) / 'Aflæsninger' (DA)

There should be a text describing the purpose of the page. And inform the user that it's only readings from remotely read meters which is shown in the view.

The page will consist of a list of measuring points with their meter values for a selected period.

  1. The following measuring points should be included:
    1. Dismounted date must be 'null' or higher than 5 years.
    2. We will pr. default only show readings on existing meters.
    3. Note: we need to decide on what to show the users in regards to usages that are an on/off-value. (AGI separate story... add reference to story regarding this)
  2. Content for each measuring point:
    1. Show the following for each measuring point (decision on order and design / Input from Mariann):
      1. Symbol linked to usage AGI-16728
      2. Usage
      3. Placement (if placement is empty, then show serial number/printed serial number). Placement is editable. Edit-symbol from Design Style Sheet. Wireframe does not shown how it will look.
      4. Type (meter super type)
      5. Latest readings / Navneændring til Time stamp.
      6. Installation date
      7. Dismount date
      8. Reading / Navnændring til Latest readings. / Unit (measurement unit)
    2. Each measuring point will be expanded as an accordion to show meter values.
      1. Title 'Meter values' - the title can be left out as we have decided to have two date-pickers, which will ensure 'balance' in the view.
      2. Date picker from- and to date, in two separate pickers. Validation is needed, to ensure that to-date it higher or equal to from-date. Reuse component from Brunata Online Administrator-site. The should not be able to select a date back in time which is prior to the occupation date.
      3. Default value is current day and five days back in time.
      4. Date picker title: 'Select date range' (EN) / 'Vælg datointerval' (DA).
    3. Show the following:
      1. 'Time stamp' (EN) / 'Tidspunkt' (DA)
      2. 'Meter value' (EN) / 'Aflæsning' (DA)
      3. Paging for results. Reuse the component for Brunata Online Administrator-site. It's up to the developer on how many readings we will show for each page.
    4. We will pr. default only show readings 5 days back in time, to ensure performance. If the user wants to see more readings, they can set an interval. The defined period should be shown to the user in the date picker.
    5. If no readings is available in the defined period, then show a message: 'No meter values available in the selected period' (EN) / 'Der er ingen aflæsninger i den valgte periode' (DA).
    6. If the number of readings returned by the backend exceed a defined criteria (up for the developer) we need show a message: 'Number of readings is too high, it exceeds [limit]. Readings prior to <date> are not shown.' (EN) / Antallet af aflæsninger er for højt, det overskrider [afgrænsning]. Aflæsninger inden <dato> bliver ikke vist' (DA).
  3. Toggle:
    1. We will like to have implemented a toggler to allow the user not to see meters which has been dismounted in the view.

In the housing service location update endpoint, there is a check to ensure that there whether or not there is any changes in the updates compared to the data in Webbill. The reason for doing this is that the updates should be manually handled, and we want to avoid spamming with updates where no changes are needed.

The comparison needs to be improved to get even fewer updates needing manual handling.

For improvement, the comparison check needs to take the following into account:

  • Many users do not use leading zeros for pro-bra-loc
  • UNIK is sending their address in one string (and not split into street, stairway, floor)
  • More? TBD - awaits investigation

This Epic is for several investigation tasks in relation to the Housing Service API log.

Additional information

Currently we have a log which consists of both, ERROR, WARNING and INFO - with no specific indication on what actions needs to be taken.

Some ERR's are logged, but sent as a 'success' to the Housing System. Some of these errors either requires manual action at Brunata or may be handeled with a more descriptive error message to the user.

The error messages we currently log might be related to the same action made by the users.

As a user, I want a button to log out of my account, so that I can securely end my session.

Additional information

Link to wireframe web: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata--Resident-Portal-?node-id=417-7552&t=IN8qptH5lWqDTHdA-4

Link to wireframe app: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata--Resident-Portal-?node-id=210-1045&t=IN8qptH5lWqDTHdA-4

  1. The user reaches the 'drop down' by clicking on the initials (green button).
  2. Given a user is logged in, when they click the log out button, then they should be logged out and redirected to the login page (AGI-16706).

Web: Remove local storage and cookie

As a user, I want to be able to navigate my profile information to change telephone number, change language, access settings to change language and access information about data and privacy.

Additional information

Link to wireframe web:

Link to wireframe app:

The user will be able to access a dropdown by clicking on the initials/avatar in the navigation bar. A dropdown will appear with the following options:

  1. Access 'My information' (AGI-16705)
  2. Access 'Settings' (AGI-16843)
  3. Access 'Data & privacy' (AGI-16844)
  4. Log out (AGI-15507)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Acceptance Criteria:

Given a user is in the profile section, then they should see fields for location address, building number, and pro-bra-loc numbers.

Given a user is in the profile section, when they enter or change their phone number, then the new number should be saved.

Estimation Notes: Backend is in place. Only difficulty is update of language. Already working for administrator.

As a user I will like to be able to navigate to my profile, to change my metrics.

Addtional information

Link to wireframe web: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata?node-id=417-5715&t=TWdBq3lwfkz6D4SL-4

Link to wireframe app: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata?node-id=199-1145&t=TWdBq3lwfkz6D4SL-4

How do we indiciate that the user has accessed the profile-section in the header? We can insert a blue-boarder?

When the user clicks the 'profile-icon' in the header, a 'drop down' will appear. The user will have the option to click 'My information' and be directed to a new page.

  1. The page 'My information' will have a header with profile information:

    1. Name
    2. Address
    3. Country code

  2. The user will see:

    1. Username (e-mail)
    2. Have the option to 'change password' and get redirected to our 'reset password'-page. The link should have an arrow to indicate that the link is outside the app.
    3. Have the option to change telephone number.
    4. Have the option to save the changes.

  3. The page will consist of four buttons to access other pages:

    1. 'My information' (EN) / 'Min information' (DA)
    2. 'Settings' (EN) / 'Indstillinger' (DA)
    3. 'Data and Privacy' (EN) / 'Privatlivspolitik' (DA)
    4. 'Log out' (EN) / 'Log ud' (DA)

  4. Each button will be clickable.

  5. Each button will have a text. In the app-version the text will be hidden.

Hej support,

Kan I fjerne adm. Adgang på anlæg 34157 og gensende en invitation til adm. Han kan ikke få lov til at logge på, og det virker ikke når han prøver at trykke glemt adgangskode.
Han bruger sit debitor nummer når han logger ind. Når han trykker glemt adgangskode, siger den at han ikke kan bruge sin mail.

Pft

Cathrine Marcussen

As we now have meters with multiple radio technologies so it can sent e.g. LoRa and Wm-Bus at the same time. We need to be able to register this on the meters and devices and we need to be able to support this through out all our systems:

  • WebBill
  • Visit
  • DeviceKit

BackEnd

Database:

  • New field on vendormodels "supports multiple radio technologies" boolean.
  • New field on meter to save "radio tech" (today this information is only saved on the vendor (this will be the default value if not set on meters) but we need to know on meter level if default is not used. (has already been done in AGI-16154)
  • New table vendormodels and radio tech. We need a new table to save what radio tech is possible on a vendermodel.

WebServices:

  • IkonWS "supports multiple radio technologies" and list of techs added to model information (meter portfolio)
  • IkonWS create meter (has already been done in AGI-16154)
  • IkonWS Update meter with "radio tech" information

FrontEnd

  • On a meter details if "supports multiple radio technologies":
    • I should be able on a master to set what "radio tech" I want to get data from on the meter.
    • I should be able to select from a list from possible radio tech from the vender model.
    • It should be possible to set value to null to be able to use the default value from vendormodel.
  • Bulk update. For meters that have "supports multiple radio technologies" it should be possible to bulk update the radio tech information. To be able to get help to select the correct meters Meter where to change the radio tech information if we have readings for the day is needed. Separate story AGI-16801

It is okay to spill this task in 2 as Database and WS is need first for the 2 other teams to start work.

TO_DO TRA when story is in test:

  • Write story for HT
  • Write stiry for ULF

Deployed to DEV.

For tester:

  • Endpoint: https://online-dev.brunata.com/public-swagger/?urls.primaryName=Reading+Out+Webservice#/system/getSystemMasterData
  • How to authorize: https://brunata.youtrack.cloud/articles/AGI-A-192/Reading-Out-webservice
  • Suggestion for how to test:
    • Call the endpoint "/systems/{systemno}/masterdata"
    • Mark one of the meters returned by the endpoint as registered using the endpoint "/meters/{meterid}/replacementregistrations"
    • Call the endpoint "/systems/{systemno}/masterdata" again with excluderegisteredmeterreplacements = true
    • Verify that the registered meter is no longer included in the response

We need a new endpoint for fetching all meter replacements for a building.

The endpoint should have an optional query parameter (boolean) for specifying whether meter replacements that are marked as registered by an external user should be included.

The response should return meter replacements grouped for location. Each meter replacement should have information about both the old and new meter and their mounting/dismounting readings.

This new endpoint is needed to be able to fetch the correct meter replacements for Evita (in AGI-16490).

Developer notes:

  • The database table meterreplacementsregisteredbyexternal contains the registered meter replacements.
  • More information about the reading out webservice and how to authorize: https://brunata.youtrack.cloud/articles/AGI-A-192/Reading-Out-webservice

As a user using Resident Portal I'll like to be met by a login page which is both translated to my preferred language and is aligned with the design for the rest of the Resident Portal.

additional information

As our current login-page is hardcoded to English and needs to be transitioned to the new User Management system (currently B2C) at some point, we'll make a new login page for the Resident Portal.

Login page for Resident Portal:

  1. We'll need a redesign of our current login page, to align the design with the rest of the Resident Portal.
  2. The user will be met by the login page when they access the app (see web below)
  3. We'll need to ensure that the current backend will correspond to the new login-page.
  4. We'll need to ensure validation on credentials if e.g. an administrator tries to login to the Resident Portal (e.g. "You're trying to access the Resident Portal with Administrator credentials").

Up for clarification (Web)

Our current login page is both for residents and administrators, when trying to access either Brunata Online or the Resident Portal. Depending on the credentials, the user is logged in to the platform relevant to them, e.g. and end user who tries to login to the Resident Portal is redirected to the Resident Portal based on the credentials provided.

If we don't go forward with the same logic, we will need to ensure the following:

  1. How will we be able to redirect the reisdent to the resident login page?
  2. Validation on user type, e.g. if an administrator tries to login to the Resident Portal, we will need to inform that a login is tried with an administrator account, the same will apply for a subuser and vice versa for a resident.

We need to clarify on whether we need a new login page for the app and or web page. So we ensure that we don't do double work.

Current onboarding of the users OK, but should we redirect to a new login page?

After claification meeting on August 5th: Stories coming up

We'll redesign and make a new login page, and ensure that the backend will correspond. Reason: Current version is not possible to translate and is backend dependent.

We'll find out whether it's possible (or most suitable) to let the administrators and residents use the same login-page - and redirect them to the correct page, depending on their user access.

We will need to ensure, that if an administrator tries to login to the Resident Portal, they'll be informed that they're trying to login with an administrator account/sub-user account, and not with Resident credentials.

As a user, I will like to have a seamless experience loggin into the platform the first time.

Additional information

We have two types of 'onboarding'-flows for the user.

  1. Creation of the user, either by the PDF the Administrator has sent the user or by the e-mail provided by Brunata.
  2. First time a user login to the platform, using the credentials provided in the first onboarding-flow.

This story is only in relation to step 2. first time a user login to the platform.

Login:

  1. The user will be met by the login form, and provide the needed credentials. Username (e-mail used for the account) and password.
  2. The user should be able to press 'login' on a button.
  3. The user will be let to the onboarding for the first time login:

Criterias for onboarding:

  1. Mandatory information set by GooglePlay and Apple.
  2. An acceptance of allowing us to use the provided e-mail to sent e-mail e.g. on released bills, EED-notifications etc. What will happen if the user denies? Still allowed to use the app, but not receiving either mails or push?
  3. An acceptance of 'Terms and Conditions' for using the app/a consent from the user.
  4. Allowance/consent to sent 'Push notifications' - probably a part of step 2.

Note for developer:

We need to ensure that we have a backend/log which is able to save the consent form the user.

As a user of Brunata Online Visual

I want to ...

So I can ...

-------------------------------------------------

analysis (single)

analyses (plural)

datakilde - data source

Meter name = meterno / address - usage -> ex. 2580 / Kattens Kvarter 29 - Humidity

-------------------------------------------------

DA: "" EN: ""

-------------------------------------------------

Technical notes:

  • The upper limit for data sources is around 150 (then it starts to get slow)
  • Depending on the period selected (if only a week is selected, it can handle around 300)
  • If showing all data sources at once, we need a virtual scrolling strategy
  • There is a max of 5000 data points on the graph
  • we restrict by readings max 5000
  • show warning that not all data sources are loading and present in ds/table/chart view

-------------------------------------------------

Authentication

We need to investigate if Visual backend can handle getting an Auth Token instead of a cookie.
per task: https://brunata.youtrack.cloud/issue/AGI-15335 it works with auth token

With the new Milesight meter (EM500-SWL) we will need a new database field, which can tell us how far down a probe has been placed in e.g. a watertank. This will e.g. allow us to know how long a wire we will need in case of a meter replacements.

The value for the field should be in cm.

We will need a boolean on modelconfigurations, which can tell us whether the field is showed or not.

It needs to be added to the following webservices:

  1. IKON webservice / Create meter (metadata on the current meter and the depth of the probe, needs to be available when the meter is recieved/created on the HT). If any further clarifications needed, ask Tilde.
  2. IKON webservice / Get model configurations (meter portfolio?)
  3. WebBill / Create and edit meter
  4. Meter import / Create meter

TO DO/TRA:

Stories / Test for HT

When running an account with a number of decimals higher than 2 for the 'amounts' in the billing results, the resulting files only include 2 decimals in the bill amount.

This is the case for all Billing result exports and export of regulation amounts.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. The number of decimals to be used in the amounts for an account is set here: https://webbill-test.brunata.dk/wb/building/59939/setupaccount/1143919/accountingdata

    Leave as is for 59939.

  2. Rerun the account from the 'status' page.

  3. In Administrator -> Formats, make a copy of/or alter the billing export format named 'Fogyasztási adatok távhős'

    1. Remove Hungarian 'column headings' (to be able to read the column headings)

    2. Add 'Cost amount' (optional)

    3. Note that amount is set to be shown with 5 decimals. This number of decimals must be less than the number of decimals set in 'Allocation data' page to have any effect.

    4. Download the file from 'Print and files' Lecture des données de consommation (4).xlsx

      The 'Amount' (total bill amount) is shown with only 2 decimals

      The 'Costs' amounts are shown with all decimals. I would expect 4 decimals.

Issue with this implementation:

If we correct this, then all exports, where the customers expect only 2 decimals will have to be updated. Maybe we should add a number of decimals = '2' on all export formats where the decimals have not been set?

On probably all DK accounts, they use 16 decimals as the number of decimals for amounts. On their templates, we only show 2 decimals on Subtotals and on the total bill amount, though. This means that we are rounding the values on the bill (and not when running the account) and the subtotals of costs for the resident does not always equal the total bill amount shown on the bill. This is a wrong process. See example here:

id","$type":"EnumProjectCustomField"},"value":null,"name":"Feature flag ID","id":"130-486","$type":"SingleEnumIssueCustomField"}],"wikifiedDescription":"

We will like to be able to add initials to Move orders generated by the use of WBSELFSERVICE / Housing Service API.

It should be possible to locate the subuser (via the API token), who have created the Move order.

In the message we will like to be able to show: 'Created by Housing Service' - 'SystemNo' - 'Online user account'

The Initials can either still be WBSELFSERVICE or Housing Service, as long as it's possible to detect who has generated the Move order.

Initials can be left empty.

-------------------

Hej,

I would like to inform that MOs registered via the Online platform WBSELFSERVICE appear without the ID of the person who creates them.

Below are examples.

If the WBSELFSERVICE platform doesn't require such an ID, then that's fine and there's no problem.


Edyta Irena Kozlowska

Many of our backend unit tests are not very robust because the e.g. rely on data in the database that can be changed, or use hardcoded ids that needs to be cleaned up. We need to rewrite these tests so that our unit testing is robust, and we only have to worry about the code and tests we are currently working on.

  • Don't use existing data in database
  • Investigate teamcity statistics to find the worst tests

--------------------

Mads notes

I noticed a problem with meters-lib tests throwing ~"max connections used" after changes to the maxConnections.

Also, it might be possible to execute "most" of the tests in parallel without too much work.

--------------------

Olivia notes

I have rewritten unit tests to not use existing data from the database or hardcoded ids in the following webservices:

  • master-data-service
  • common-webservice
  • radiator-model-library-service
  • orders-webservice
  • import-export-webservice

Team city statistics investigation:

  • I have tried to investigate team city statistics but was not able to find many useful statistics.

  • One thing I found that might be useful is that after running all tests, they can be sorted by duration to find any slow tests (e.g. https://teamcity.brunata.dk/buildConfiguration/Webservices_Build/35084?buildTab=tests&orderBy=duration&order=desc).

    • The three slowest tests take 10 minutes in total to run. They are all testing deviation notification rules. In the endpoint called in the tests, all deviation notification rules in the database are fetched. This means that the tests will probably become slower and slower to run as more deviation notification rules are created in prod. These unit tests might be rewritten when the new Online app is developed. Therefore, it might not make sense to change it now, but it is something to keep in mind when developing the app.

We still use code from webbill-backend in the Webservices project.
webbill-backend has vulnerabilities through external libraries and uses old versions of spring and hibernate.
We need to introduce the relevant logic in the Webservices project, so we can remove our dependency on webbill-backend.

From Mikael Bostrøm:

  • Vi vil gerne have mulighed for at kunne trigge fakturering for forgæves besøg (BV ordre)- jeg ved ikke om i allerede har denne feature for branch 300

-------------------------

As a responsible for invoicing in Brunata

I would like the invoicing of unsuccessful visits of Service orders from webbill to be invoiced automatically

so that I can save time on my invoicing effort.

Additional information

  1. A job has been implemented for DK which should also be implemented for the Sweden orders (branch 300) - AGI-13955
  2. We need to use texts in Swedish
    1. Info not available yet (MIKB)
  3. Maybe some settings in the call to SAP must be changed
    1. Info not available yet (MIKB)

We have identified an issue in which the app seems to be saving an incorrect allounit for hot water to the agents. The meter is W, but it is the value for V that is displayed (Water for hot water tank) and saved in the agents. I've related the issue to this task AGI-16420 and copied the reported issue below.

Hi,

The resident for 63353 b9780 doesn’t understand why he is only able to choose hot water in the Brunata App? We don’t measure hot water. Only cold.

Can you help?
Berit Thoby

As I am unable to test this, I'm sending it over to you for further investigation. And the user is right, there are no hot water meters installed in this apartament.

As a WebBill user

I want to be able to update the radio technology on mater meters that support multiple radio technologies

so that I can work efficiently on adapting the technology when needed

Additional information

  1. This should be a feature on the 'Meter stock' page -> action cogwheel

    Name the feature 'Change radio technology on meters' (EN) - 'Skift radio teknologi på målere' (DA)

  2. When clicking the feature, I need to be able to select the technology that I want to change from and the one I want to change to.

    'Change from radio technology' (EN) - 'Skift fra radioteknologi' (DA) -> Drop down with radio technologies existing in the current meters in the building for meters supporting multiple radio technologies (see AGI-16790)

    'Change to radio technology' (EN) - 'Skift til radioteknologi' (DA) -> Drop down with radio technologies that are possible to use on the current meters in the building that support multiple radio technologies.

  3. Buttons to cancel or continue.

  4. If I click 'Continue' I want to get a page with a list of meters matching the criteria (the 'from' and 'to' technologies, 'current' meter, 'master meter').

    1. Page title -> as feature name in the cogwheel
    2. Text: These meters will be corrected (same text as for 'Change meter configuration')
    3. 'Change from radio technology' -> display 'from' value'
    4. 'Change to radio technology' -> display 'to' value'

  5. Show the following information about the meters:

    1. Brunata no.
    2. Meter sequence no.
    3. Meter no.
    4. Printed meter no.
    5. Installation date
    6. Latest reading date
    7. Usage
    8. Primary channel usage
    9. Current technology

  6. The columns should have filtering options and sorting

  7. Enable the user to select meters with a check box. 'Select all' should select all meters currently visible in the list

  8. Buttons to cancel and 'Correct meters'

  9. If I click correct meters, then the radio technology should be changed on those meters.

Currently, our backend does not correctly infer the meter value type of the data sources.

For example, for meters whose parent is of the type "Meter virtualization", we need to add an extra check based on "counting method".

Tilde says: It should differ from "I" as I will not be a consumption meter. As "I" is often used for temperature and state values

Implications

Due to the discrepancy in the meter value types, we are unable to approve some team tests and user tests since they require the meter value type to be correctly defined - which ultimately breaks the flow.

Hi,

I came across an error in Croatian (branch 130) building 25605.
In this building we are using the “Empty – Copenhagen – DK” degree days table, and I suspect the problem comes from it only having values up to 01.08.2025.
Without them we cannot finish allocations and provide exports to clients.

Would you be able to add next values?


Best regards / Pozdrawiam,

Michał Dolecki

Should the user add it manually, or do you use a robot to fill in the values?

As a user of Brunata Online Visual

I want to be able to edit my data source

So I update the information on it

Mockup

Modal: https://balsamiq.cloud/sxo5ezq/p2pbllu/r92A4

Edit data source modal

The modal is opened in the "data source view": AGI-15141

The modal should have a close button with a close icon

Title: DA: "Rediger datakilde" EN: "Edit data source"

It should have the following fields:

Read-only fields

  1. DA: "System" EN: "System"
    1. buildingno, buildingname -> ex. "10354 - KAB Hovedkontor"
  2. DA: "Rum id" EN: "Room id"
    1. aka. "placement"
  3. DA: "Adresse" EN: "Address"
    1. Address of the system (building)

Editable fields

  1. DA: "Gruppe" EN: "Group"
  2. DA: "Meter navn" EN: "Meter name"
    1. Meter name = meterno / address - usage -> ex. "2580 / Kattens Kvarter 29 - Humidity"
  3. DA: "Vælg værdi" EN: "Select value"
    1. Radio buttons where you can choose between Meter value or Consumption
    2. It should not be possible to select value = consumption if the meter is not a consumption meter.
  4. DA: "Akse" EN: "Axis"
    1. Radio buttons where you can choose between Meter value or Consumption
  5. DA: "Farve" EN: "Color "
    1. It should work as it currently does in the old visual.

Choices’ buttons

DA: "Annuller" EN: "Cancel"

  1. Closes the modal without saving.

DA: "Gem" EN: "Save"

  1. Closes and saves the changes.
  2. Should also display a box (toast) with either a success or fail

Jeg skal bruge en rapport over alle regnskaber i DK med visning af antal lejemål deltagende pr. regnskab, således jeg kan se hvilke anlæg vi har med forskel i antal lejemål i henholdsvis vand. Varme og EL regnskabet.

Med venlig hilsen / Best regards,

Maja Rothmann
Forbrugsregnskabschef

+45 50 60 70 48
MRO@brunata.com

--------------

Buildings in branch 10, 11, 12

The report must get data from the newest account where an allocation has been run

If possible, one line pr. account?

Account must have operations state <> 'U'

Info about:

  • Building no.
  • Administrator no.
  • Account no.
  • Account type
  • Account name
  • Period end date
  • Number of locations participating in the account

{"attachments":[{"url":"/api/files/8-48478?sign=MTc1NTM4ODgwMDAwMHwxLTQzNHw4LTQ4NDc4fHNKTXExLTlMY1hFU3V0STNXNTh0YjVuZEJmNkRmZWE0VHdpWV9QZFlSYWsNCg&updated=1754309160181","name":"image003.png","$type":"IssueAttachment"},{"url":"/api/files/8-48479?sign=MTc1NTM4ODgwMDAwMHwxLTQzNHw4LTQ4NDc5fGFzc0xjMWRWTXplSTVHVXp1SUhLSnBXTDJyaDY2eURYVXlRNHd0Wm9GaWMNCg&updated=1754309160204","name":"image001.png","$type":"IssueAttachment"}],"comments":[{"textPreview":"

The sum of units on allounit 'O' used in the calculation for estimation by building totals for the fictive meters is 29215,36.

This does not correspond to the sum of 'O' units on all the other locations which is 28787,76

The sum of m2 used in the calculation corresponds exactly to the sum of m2 for 'all other apartments'. So I am deducing that they are all part of the sum of units. I cannot see why the sum of units is different. It does not seem to be the sum without reduction factor (this amounts to 30264,82 units).

What other else could it be? Is this related to unit reduction? or maybe dismounted/installed meters during the period (periodisation) in br.no. 920?

","author":{"name":"Birgitte Grünfeld","login":"BGR","$type":"User"},"deleted":false,"updated":null,"created":1754463868699,"id":"4-112762","$type":"IssueComment"},{"textPreview":"

@Support team

I cannot find the reason for the difference in the sums myself. I will ask a developer.

BR

Birgitte

Hi,

Could you check why WB changed consumption when calculating fictive meters?

When the user entered zeroes manually for the locations with fictive meters, WB took into consideration the following consumption value 28787.76

However, when fictive meters were estimated according to the “average consumption” method, then a higher consumption was used to calculate the per m² value 29 215,36, instead of 28787.76. Why?

Reporter: Monika Kwiatkowska
Polish billing department specialist

@Mariann Sihm Larsen I've made this mock up on the basis of our discussions last week. Perhaps Martin has some recommendations/ideas for how to make a 'top notch' navigation drill down/drill up on (hours, days, months, years), ref. to the meeting booked on Tuesday 12th of August. But his focus will probably need to be on the deliverables for the next sprint, why we'll probably need to make the final decisions ourselves in relation to the MyHome-page. I've updated AGI-15517 in relation to our latests discussions. It's not final, but if any questions, lets talk!

This task is for research into:

  • How can we rethink the design of the MyHome page (for the consumption), to make us one of the best on the market

  • Architectual thoughts in relation to:

    • Navigation in data (drill down/drill up)
    • Date-picking (fixed period) and navigation in relation to this
    • Definition of standard views (e.g. what data will the user be presented, order of date range, etc. when they navigate to the page)
    • More???

Link for current wireframe in Figma: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata?node-id=373-2875&t=VRJTWlZxTjnmYaDW-4

As a user of Brunata Online Visual

I want to be able to access a user guide

So I can get help to figure out how to use Visual

Note from PO

It's has been agreed with Marketing, that the User Guide should be located in ClickHelp (a new tool for our website/Brunata.com) which is available for both Subsidaries and Partners. This allows for us to link to the User Guide, without worring about version control/language, as the rest of the group will be warned about changes to the 'master' and translate/update themselves locally.

Reach out to Ida and Malene, when time is.

This seems to be a frontend bug, so I will leave it for a frontend developer.

Here are my findings:

  • The PUT request from the frontend sends the shifted amounts. Maybe it has something to do with a reverse order of the amount, but I'm not sure. Here are my inputted amounts vs the amounts sent in the request:

  • You do not have to run the account to get the shifted values. Just refreshing the resident list page is enough.

  • Generally, the fields are just acting really weird when editing them sometimes (they jump around when editing, and then shifting again when refreshing the page):

@Olivia Rose Gliese Winkel I found out that the difference was caused by "validate consumption" showing litres and Visual showing cubic meters. Furthermore, Visual used the wrong decimal separator when formatting the values. I have fixed the decimal separator to avoid the confusion.

As a user of Brunata Online Visual

I want to be able to see a char over my data sources' meter value

So I can visualize the usage

Mockup

Empty: https://balsamiq.cloud/sxo5ezq/p2pbllu/r18B4

Data present: https://balsamiq.cloud/sxo5ezq/p2pbllu/r9E1B

Overall

Breadcrumb:

  1. Like on the other pages in Online, we want a title: DA: "Visual" EN: "Visual"
    1. Following that, we want the name of the analysis that the user is on ex. "Visual / name of analysis"

Back button and edit the name of the analysis:

  1. We also want a back button icon to enable the user to go back to the overview of the analyses
  2. The user should be able to see the name of the analysis and edit it by clicking on a pencil icon

Tabs:

We want taps to navigate between the available pages of the analysis, they should match the design of other taps in Online ex. on the Online reporting page.

There are three taps:

  1. DA: "Datakilder" EN: "Data sources"
  2. DA: "Tabel" EN: "Table"
  3. DA: "Chart" EN: "Chart"

Empty view

Should have a text: DA: "Vælg eller tilføj datakilder for at vise diagram" EN: "Select and add data sources to display chart"

Data present

Change the graph lib to Apache Echarts.
Implement the changes from the mockup.

id","$type":"EnumProjectCustomField"},"value":null,"name":"Feature flag ID","id":"130-486","$type":"SingleEnumIssueCustomField"}],"wikifiedDescription":"

We have to deliver information on meter replacements on new meters in XML to Evita via the virtual "FTP". One folder for each replacement - meter down/meter up.

  1. Use ’reading out API’ (get master data / AGI-16485) to deliver information on new/replaced meters on current day.
  2. Elbek&Vejrup will like a file for every meter replacement, no matter the circumstances e.g. an administrative meter replacement.

The information on and the placement of the XML is as follows:

  • Automatisk indlæsning af vandmålerudskiftninger (see attachment), both folder-structure and the required data is mapped.
  • An example of the structure of the XML-file (see attachment).
    • XML file (from Brunata to Evita)
      • Meter replacement
      • V{Forbrugsstednr.} (Folder)
    • jpg (from Brunata to Evita)
      • V{Forbrugsstednr.} (Folder)
        • Attachments (Pictures if available)
        • Note: It's only a requirement for Lemvig to access the pictures via Brunata Online and therefore it should not be included as a part of the XML.
    • Elbek will remove the files from the FTP when they have been imported.

NOTE FROM PO (june 23rd)

Requirements for naming and placement of the file, is specified in the attached PDF:

When I create or update devices in BDI I should be able to get model information by entering a itemno or external Item no.

If this number is connected to a model config information should be auto-filled or partly filled.

Some item numbers can be used on multiple models, and therefore not all information can be filled, but the users need to select the configuration themselves. For unique items all information can be set.

Should also be used during Import.

Note some models don't have items and then the user has to enter values by themselves. But for all new models this information should be available if meters are purchased by Brunata.

This improvement will help user to select the correct model information, as often we get this information in the files or filenames.

Note! item information should overrule the automatic filling we have today by manufucure and meter number logic

While looking into a support ticket (mail) on building 61203, I had trouble finding what meter was missing a reading:

All meters in the building have the same meter no 'Forbrug overføres fra anlæg 46902' and the meter id is not searchable.

I would like a weblang key for 'READING_MISSING':

Missing reading: No reading available with a reading date equal to or lower than <date> for meter no. <meterno>, meterid <meterid> in br.no. <brunatano>, sequence no. <metersequenceno> (EN)

Manglende aflæsning: Ingen aflæsning tilgængelig med en aflæsningsdato lig med eller mindre end <date> for målernr. <meterno>, meterid <meterid> i br.nr. <brunatano>, løbenr. <metersequenceno> (DA)

As a user, I want a landing page, so that I can easily navigate to relevant sections.

Additional information

Link to wireframes TBD

  1. The landing page should consist of the following basic elements, no matter which meters is available on the location.
    1. A header saying: 'Hey [Firstname]' (EN) / 'Hej [Firstname]' (DA)
    2. A text below the header showing SystemNo and LocationNo.
    4. Links to Saving tips (external links to ClickHelp).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Acceptance Criteria:

Given a user is on the landing page, then they should see…

Landing Page Design: BO Resident WEB

Estimation Notes: Landing page

This is the landing page and estimates stick while the view changes. This needs to be update to reflect what the new design prescribes.

As a user, I want a consistent menu structure and design across the web page and app, so that I have a seamless experience.

Additional information:

Link to wireframes: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata?node-id=0-1&t=9Wr8v1DODTo49zx5-1

For web:

Link to wireframe-header for web: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata?node-id=417-7552&t=1DHk6KTesrlXhsqs-4

For app:

Link to wireframe-header for app: https://www.figma.com/design/SouWC2lHdZik9mdkOuobjD/My-Brunata?node-id=286-3342&t=1DHk6KTesrlXhsqs-4

Header/navigation

  1. The navigation is expected to have 5 main menu items, besides the Brunata Online-logo (a new logo for the app is currently being worked on by Marketing) and the address-, profile- and notification-section

  2. The Brunata Online-logo needs to work as a 'Home-button' sending the user back to the 'Overview'-page.

    1. Main menu items:
      1. Overview (EN) / Overblik (DA)
      2. MyHome (EN) / MyHome (EN)
      3. Monitoring (EN) / Overvågning (DA)
      4. PREVIOUS: Devices (EN) NOW: 'Readings' (EN) / 'Aflæsninger' (DA)
      5. Archive (EN) / Arkiv (DA)
    2. We should only show main menu items if the user has content to see. E.g. the 'archive' main menu item requires that the user has either EED-notifications or bills etc.
      1. The user will access the 'Overview'-page as a default. If the user e.g. don't have access to any meters yet they will get access to a message saying: 'We don't have any meter data to show you' (EN) and access to 'Saving tips'. (AGI separate story... add reference to story regarding content of the Landing page)

  3. Location address

    1. Needs to be formatted to the specific country.

  4. Profile short-cut (Link to Profile Section story: AGI-15520)

    1. The header for the Profile could be the intials of the user logged in. The developer should find a way to make a two letter abbreviation for a resident name. If any corner-cases e.g. a resident being named '.' or not has a name then use a non-binary person symbol.
    2. The button has to be green and color and content/initials should not be customizable.

  5. Notification symbol

    1. A symbol for notifications, indicating whether I have unread notifications since I logged into the profile last time (AGI separate story... add reference to story regarding notification-content)

  6. We will like for the header to be dynamic.

  7. When scrolling up and down on a page it would be nice to know whether I have reached the top/buttom of the page. Developers will investigate whether we can use the native gestures(cross platforms), e.g. how to reach the top of the page/navigate back and forth.

  8. We will need content placeholders (basic component skeleton with animation) to indicate for the user that the page is loading.

This epic will be a collection of tasks related to the item management project. The project is a subproject to the system from offer to setup (9210204)

Going forward WebBill will be item master and make sure to distribute information to relevant systems by API calls, and all items will be started and handled by WebBill. See more in the 9210204_05 project description folder.

Frontend for item management will be handled in DeviceKit where items today already are created and maintained for WebBill and Visit

The project will handle the following:

  • Database changes
  • Frontend WebBill
    • Create meter by item and save item on master
    • see item no on meter details
    • Administrative change copy item
    • see and change items on an order
    • Items/models on select meters to order (create or edit orders)
  • Frontend DeviceKit
    • Create/Edit items
    • Portfolio
    • Models
  • API
    • IKON WS
    • BIAB API
      • create glasswing
      • create CRM
      • API _log

","author":{"name":"Birgitte Grünfeld","login":"BGR","$type":"User"},"deleted":false,"updated":null,"created":1753788230868,"id":"4-112696","$type":"IssueComment"},{"textPreview":"

Note!

I can see that the volume values are only transmitted as a historical value for these meters, and therefore we don't have daily readings from them. This is how the meter is set up,so data is coming in as expected.

this is the value and date also seen in WebBill

If we have an issue with KAM meters, please report the issue as this is not a general issue, so we need to look into each as a separated task.

I will close this task

BR, Tilde

Hi Support,

I have previously been in dialogue with Kees and Tilde regarding a new API call between Brunata and Enity.
Enity is our partner in the Energy Management System, EMS.
As it is now, they pull consumption data via meter ID from Devicekit, but only from meters located in fictitious apartments or apartments with apartment numbers between 9900-9999.

We want the API call, to only call based on the meter ID, that we inform Enity about, and not based on specific apartment numbers.

I hope It makes sense, otherwise I will be happy to elaborate on it.

Med venlig hilsen / Best regards,

Sofie Lafrenz
Projektkoordinator, Brunata Energy Management

+45 50 60 72 69
SOLA@brunata.com

[Brunata]http://brunata.dk/

As a superuser for Item management, I want to be able to obsolete Items when they are no longer needed in the Brunata Portfolio.

When an Item is obsolete, it will get an end date, and it means that Brunata will no longer have the item in resale from that day and on. But we will still have the support for the items.

And as we have the support for the item and integration to other systems, it should not be possible to perform a delete.

Task:

  • Remove the Delete from the Items overview

  • In Edit when setting an obsolete date:

    • Hard warning: "When you set an obsolete date on an item, this will remove the resale flag on all related models. Do you want to continue?

      No: Return to edit and set focus in obsolete date

      Yes: Save and remove all flags for "resale" on models connected to this item. (there is no need to check if it is or not, just do an update as all should be removed no matter what)

Pls let me know if you see any better design options :)

@Tilde Rasmussen The following SQL finds all items that have multiple values across modelconfigurationitems and thus must be cleaned up, before the columns METERSIZE, METERBUILDLENGTH, METERCONNECTIONTYPEID, TEMPERATURE, FLOW, EXPECTEDBATTERYLIFETIME in modelconfigurationitems are moved to items (14 modelconfigurationitems in total):

select * from modelconfigurationitems where itemid in (
    select itemid from (
        SELECT
            ITEMID,
            COUNT(DISTINCT METERSIZE) AS MeterSizeVariants,
            COUNT(DISTINCT METERBUILDLENGTH) AS MeterBuildLengthVariants,
            COUNT(DISTINCT METERCONNECTIONTYPEID) AS MeterConnectionTypeVariants,
            COUNT(DISTINCT TEMPERATURE) AS TemperatureVariants,
            COUNT(DISTINCT FLOW) AS FlowVariants,
            COUNT(DISTINCT EXPECTEDBATTERYLIFETIME) AS ExpectedBatteryLifeVariants
        FROM
            MODELCONFIGURATIONITEMS
        GROUP BY
            ITEMID
        HAVING
            COUNT(DISTINCT METERSIZE) > 1
            OR COUNT(DISTINCT METERBUILDLENGTH) > 1
            OR COUNT(DISTINCT METERCONNECTIONTYPEID) > 1
            OR COUNT(DISTINCT TEMPERATURE) > 1
            OR COUNT(DISTINCT FLOW) > 1
            OR COUNT(DISTINCT EXPECTEDBATTERYLIFETIME) > 1
    )  duplicate_items)

items that have multiple values have been cleaned up d.d in prod :)

@Tilde Rasmussen The following SQL updates all ITEMS with data from MODELCONFIGURATIONITEMS (must be run before database changes in prod)

UPDATE ITEMS i

SET (METERSIZE, METERBUILDLENGTH, METERCONNECTIONTYPEID, TEMPERATURE, FLOW, EXPECTEDBATTERYLIFETIME) = 
(SELECT METERSIZE, METERBUILDLENGTH, METERCONNECTIONTYPEID, TEMPERATURE, FLOW, EXPECTEDBATTERYLIFETIME
FROM MODELCONFIGURATIONITEMS WHERE ITEMID = i.ITEMID FETCH FIRST 1 ROWS ONLY) 

WHERE EXISTS (
SELECT 1 FROM MODELCONFIGURATIONITEMS WHERE ITEMID= i.ITEMID
);
","author":{"name":"Bo Bjerregaard Blichfeldt Henriksen","login":"bohe","$type":"User"},"deleted":false,"updated":1754571653019,"created":1754569232596,"id":"4-112812","$type":"IssueComment"},{"textPreview":"

Select all items including optional weblang text

sql
select i.itemid, i.itemnumber, i.Description, v.value
from items i
left join weblang.keys k on (k.name = i.itemnumber and k.viewid = 4161)
left join weblang."VALUES" v on (v.keyid = k.id and v.localizationid = 2304)

As a user with the correct user rights, I can today create Items via DeviceKit in WebBill.

The structure has been changed, and therefore the creation items frontend should be updated to match the new

structure.

As is:

To be:

Add or Edit Items:

Items number *

External item number

Description *

Item text * (are not saved in item database - but in weblang and should be read only for edit, see more information later in this story).

Item Type *

Item Unit *

Meter super type

If Item Type = Device then

(the following fields are today known when you add Items to modelconfig - but should be rmoved from there and added her instead)

METERSIZE
METERBUILDLENGTH
METERCONNECTIONTYPEID
TEMPERATURE
FLOW
EXPECTEDBATTERYLIFETIME

For all items it should be possible to click (check box) on with Brunata Branches the item is used - Default when create check on all branchs

Something like this but with brunata branches

WebLang information - Item text:

In edit mode we only show text in en and as read only after creation - edit text should only be done in translation portale.



select v.value from weblang.keys k

inner join weblang."VALUES" v on (v.keyid = k.id)

inner join weblang.LOCALIZATIONS l on (l.id = v.LOCALIZATIONid)

inner JOIN weblang.locales c on (c.id = l.localeid and c.languagecode = 'en')

where name like :itemid;

Create new key in weblang in database:

weblang.keys

viewid = 4161

Name = should be ITEMID

weblang."VALUES"

LOCALIZATIONid = 2304

value = should be Item text

Dear,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing to kindly follow up on my previous message regarding the Elvaco CMe210 LTE installed in building number 66384 in Rotterdam, which is connected to six heat meters.

 

As mentioned earlier, we have already run the “install 6 clean” and “sch report2” commands, and the meters have been created in WebBill. However, no meter readings have appeared yet.

 

Could you please check whether data from the Elvaco unit is being received correctly on your end?

We would also appreciate any advice on whether additional configuration steps might be needed.

 

Thank you in advance for your support.

We look forward to your response.

","author":{"name":"Tomasz Rochala","login":"TORO","$type":"User"},"deleted":false,"updated":null,"created":1749634342591,"id":"4-112073","$type":"IssueComment"},{"textPreview":"

Hello,

The settings in the gateway look to be okay.

I cannot see the gateway serial number in this task? could you please help me.

Also the meters in the buildings need to be created as M-bus meters to be able to get readings.

what model/type of meters are installed so we can check if we have the support?

BR, Tilde

","author":{"name":"Tilde Rasmussen","login":"TRA","$type":"User"},"deleted":false,"updated":null,"created":1750229450434,"id":"4-112217","$type":"IssueComment"},{"textPreview":"

Hi Tilde,

Thank you for your response:

 

As far as I know, the serial number of the gateway is 0148014472.

According to a reading from the Izar Center, the model/type of the meters is Elster F96 (v53). However, under the hood, these are essentially Sharky 775 meters.

For more details, please refer to the Excel file that I attached to my email dated May 28th.

 

","author":{"name":"Tomasz Rochala","login":"TORO","$type":"User"},"deleted":false,"updated":null,"created":1750399044753,"id":"4-112257","$type":"IssueComment"},{"textPreview":"

I can't find any trace of us getting mbus file from 0148014472.
Are you sending us XLSX file? It must be in CSV format. Further the contents does not follow the specification, which is currently not why we don't get readings, as we apparently don't get any files at all.
So the issue must be somewhere outside my area.
@Tilde Rasmussen

Good afternoon,

We have recently installed an Elvaco M-Bus Master, model CMe210 LTE, in a building located in Rotterdam. This device is connected to six heat meters via M-Bus.

When I visited the location on April 22nd, I already sent the command "install 6 clean" to the device in order to search for the meters on the M-Bus. A few minutes later, I received an SMS confirmation stating that the installation was successful and that the expected number of devices had been found.

We have continued working on the M-Bus master and the building where it is installed — building number 66384.

To ensure that meter readings are transmitted to Brunata’s servers, we configured the M-Bus master using the following command:

sch report2 1hour 3109 http://gplt-upload.brunata.dk/api/mbus/readings2

In addition, the meters have been created in the object within WebBill. However, we are not yet seeing any meter readings appear.

Is it possible that we missed a step during the meter setup or data configuration?

We would appreciate it if you could check and let us know how to proceed.

See also the attached files for details about these meters.

Best regards,

Tomasz R.
Technical Supporter Brunata a/s

Dear Support,

We have continued working on the M-Bus master and the building where it is installed — building number 66384.

To ensure that meter readings are transmitted to Brunata’s servers, we configured the M-Bus master using the following command:
sch report2 1hour 3109 http://gplt-upload.brunata.dk/api/mbus/readings2

In addition, the meters have been created in the object within WebBill. However, we are not yet seeing any meter readings appear.

Is it possible that we missed a step during the meter setup or data configuration?
We would appreciate it if you could check and let us know how to proceed.

See also the attached files for details about these meters.

Met vriendelijke groet / Best regards,

@Tilde Rasmussen, is this correct understood?

The following fields must be readonly:

  • Meter size
  • Meter build length
  • Meter Connection Type
  • Temperature
  • Flow
  • Expected battery life

The following fields must be removed:

  • Name

The following fields are kept as is:

  • Product link
  • Available for purchase
  • Reading in
  • Create with HT

As a user user with correct user right to model mangement we need some changes to the way we link items to models as the database structure have been changes.

In view mode (picture below) we should still show same information (but is now a join between items and MODELCONFIGURATIONITEMID)

When we link item some fields are no longer used and therefore should be shown as read only in frontend and create/edit like itemid and description is today.

Hi @Tilde Rasmussen

Is it possible to fix telegram data so that it is consistent throughout?

For example, meter no.: 15870049 transmitted values from 06/05/2024 to 13/05/2024 as follows:

from 13/05/2024 to 19/12/2024 like so:

and then from 20/12/2024 onwards, the data is transmitted the same way as it was at the beginning.

As the reporter mentions, this is like so for all the water meters in this building.

The reporter is asking again whether this issue can be resolved as he is getting emails from the residents.

BR, Tilde

We have an issue with the IkonWS.

In Swagger, we can see that the countingMethod should be included in the getBuilding.

But when we get the building this value is never present??

https://webbill-dev.brunata.dk/swagger/?urls.primaryName=Ikon+webservice#/Buildings/getBuilding

Also Note!!

Counting Method can differ from slave to master, so please check that we are not only returning the master value but only use as fallback if values is not set specific on the slave.

Hello,

In this building there are 8 gas meters of which the read out in WB jump one decimal higher although the input from the Zenner datahub stays the same see pictures below.
Please fix this so that we have a correct read out in WB again for these 8 gas meters.

WB:

Zenner data hub:

Jelke van der Kooi

Hi ,
The timestamp that we see in WebBill for the electricity meters from DZG that are directly processed via the RIS has the wrong timestamp.
All readings are in GMT instead of GMT+2.

Met vriendelijke groet / Best regards / Mit freundlichen Grüssen,

Wim Wiegers
Directeur

Warmtemeterservice B.V.
James Wattstraat 24
NL-8912 AS Leeuwarden
Tel +31 (0)515 575 222 (algemeen)

Mail wwi@wms.nlmailto:wwi@wms.nl

Web www.wms.nlhttp://www.wms.nl/ / www.brunata.nlhttp://www.brunata.nl/

","author":{"name":"Ida Frederikke Voss Winther","login":"idfr","$type":"User"},"deleted":false,"updated":1755076688496,"created":1755076665667,"id":"4-112903","$type":"IssueComment"},{"textPreview":"

@Ida Frederikke Voss Winther Hi Ida

Yes, this change is literally a one-liner if we really need it.

However, let us take a step back and think about it:

Why do we want to show it?

Because it makes it easier for the user to discern consumption versus meter values.

Why does it make it easier for the user to discern consumption versus meter values?

Because the user can explicitly see the meter value type for the given column of data.

Why could the user not see this before?

Maybe they could. For example, the units implicitly tell the user whether we are looking at consumption or meter values.

For example, if you see 20C° on the table, then you would implicitly know that it is a meter value and not consumption, conversely, if you see kWh, you can assume it is consumption.

Final thoughts

Does it make sense to add this if we can infer the meter value type from the reading's unit type?
No.

However, I am unsure whether there exist edge-cases for this.

We want to be able to show consumption in Visual in the table chart view.

Developer notes:

only available with normalized intervals.
Consumption = meter value over time (increase over time).

ex. value is 1,5 on monday. on tuesday it is 2.0. have to show the increase so 0.5

use table metersupertype column isConsumptionMeter to see if has consumption or not.
use column sumConsumption from the Readings table to keep track of the last value since some meters reset.

Team Test ❌
Sometimes the page wont load correctly. and the filter on dates is a little strange.

Otherwise the UI looks good to me ✅
Empty page ✅

  1. Page load
    1. Sometimes Visual doesnt load at all on Dev now.
      It just keeps saying loading
      1. When it does work, the it loads on card view
      2. on first load. all translations are missing
      3. on reload. translations are loaded
    2. If I open an analysis, and click back. then I end up on the "choose building page" ❌
    3. When I navigate back to visual. the pages cannot load any more. Now I have to navigate to choose buildings, and then back to visual again. and then the page loads correctly
  2. Table view
    2. Holds the users' current analyses in a table view.
    3. It should have filtration on all columns except the options column

It should have pagination and page size.
    Pagination and page size should follow what we use in Online reporting
    4. The filtering on dates behaves unexpected. by filtering everything after the selected date. I would think either it should be on excact date match. or else endPeriod should filter with the selected data as the max date. such that one can filter in between start period and end period ❌
  3. the table should have the following columns: ✅
Name of the analysis - DA: "Navn" EN: "Name"
The number of data sources chosen for the analysis – DA: "Datakilder" EN: "Data sources"
The period that the analysis covers over - DA: "Periode" EN: "Period"
DA: "Options" EN: "Options"
    The Options column should hold:
        A copy button with a copy icon that copies the analysis and adds "copy of" ex: "copy of analysis123"
        A delete button with a trashcan icon. When clicked on, it should open a modal that asks the user if they are sure they want to delete.
            Title: DA: "Slet analyse?" EN: "Delete analysis?"
            Text: DA: "Er du sikker på du vil slette" EN: "Are you sure you want to delete" and then name of the analysis ex: "Are you sure you want to delete Testudtræk nr. 2 ?"
            Cancel button DA: "Annuller" EN: "Cancel"
            Continue button DA: "Fortsæt" EN: "Continue
  1. Card UI ✅
    The card should have the following info:
DA: "Navn" EN: "Name"
DA: "Datakilder" EN: "Data sources"
DA: "Periode" EN: "Period"
Vertical options (three dots) that hold:
    Copy and delete like in the table view
    Edit - DA: "Rediger" EN: "Edit " that opens the analysis
An Edit button on the card with a pencil icon which opens the analysis when clicked on
DA: "Åben" EN: "Open"
    an button that allow the user to open and go to the analysis

Common for Table and Card/tile view ✅

When analyses are present in a table or card view, we want to move the part for the user guide to the upper left corner.

In the upper right corner, we want:

  1. Button: Create new analysis (see empty view part)
  2. A button to change between table and card view. This should be two icons

  2. We will like for the text to be:

    1. Ønsker du at slette analysen? Du er ved at slette analysen [navn på analysen] (DA)
    2. Do you wish to delete the analysis? You are about to delete the analysis [name of analysis] (EN)

Card/Tile view

  1. If the user has a very long name for the analysis, without any breaks, the text continues out of the box and hides the 'more'-menu. ❌

@Ida Frederikke Voss Winther - Ah, okay! Now I understand what you mean. What you're asking for is currently a bit tricky to implement because of how our system is built. Let me explain:

The Current Setup: Right now, we have two separate projects working together:

  • Brunata Online - This handles the side menu and main navigation you see
  • Visual Project - This is embedded inside the Online project (like a picture frame within a larger frame)

Because these are two separate systems, making changes that affect both the navigation and the visual content requires coordinating between both projects, which makes things more complex.

We're planning to combine these two projects into one, which solves this issue. But for now would how it is now be fine?

As a user of Brunata Online Visual

I want to be able to create analyses

So I can monitor and compare meter values and consumption of different meters

This is the landing page for Visual, which you enter from the left menu in Online.

A building has to have the service for Visual to access it. (the service is set in WebBill -> building information -> services)

Mockup

The overview page has three possible views:

  1. Empty: https://balsamiq.cloud/sxo5ezq/p2pbllu/r9AE7
  2. Table: https://balsamiq.cloud/sxo5ezq/p2pbllu/r9FFB
  3. Card/tile: https://balsamiq.cloud/sxo5ezq/p2pbllu/r0AD0

Overall view

Like on the other pages in Online, we want a title: DA: "Visual" EN: "Visual"

Empty view

Title: DA: "Første gang du bruger Visual?" EN: "First time using Visual?"

Text: DA: "Klik her" EN: "Click here"

Link to user guide DA: "Bruger guide" EN: "User guide" different story for the user guide itself (AGI-15147)

Button: create a new analysis

It opens a modal for entering the name of the new analysis.

Button DA: "Opret ny analyse" EN: "Create new analysis"

Text: DA: "Ingen analyser oprettet endnu" EN: "No analyses created yet"

Modal: enter analysis name

Title: DA: "Opret ny analyse" EN: "Create new analysis"

The modal should have a close button with a close icon

input field with default name DA: "Ny unavngiven analyse" EN: "New unnamed analysis" that the user can change if they want to

DA: "Annuller" EN: "Cancel"

  1. Closes the modal without saving.

DA: "Create" EN: "Opret"

  1. Closes and saves the changes.
  2. when the user clicks save takes them to: https://balsamiq.cloud/sxo5ezq/p2pbllu/r7A67

Table view

Holds the users' current analyses in a table view.

  1. It should have filtration on all columns except the options column
  2. It should have pagination and page size.
    1. Pagination and page size should follow what we use in Online reporting

the table should have the following columns:

  1. Name of the analysis - DA: "Navn" EN: "Name"
  2. The number of data sources chosen for the analysis – DA: "Datakilder" EN: "Data sources"
  3. The period that the analysis covers over - DA: "Periode" EN: "Period"
  4. DA: "Options" EN: "Options"
    1. The Options column should hold:
      1. A copy button with a copy icon that copies the analysis and adds "copy of" ex: "copy of analysis123"
      2. A delete button with a trashcan icon. When clicked on, it should open a modal that asks the user if they are sure they want to delete.
        1. Title: DA: "Slet analyse?" EN: "Delete analysis?"
        2. Text: DA: "Er du sikker på du vil slette" EN: "Are you sure you want to delete" and then name of the analysis ex: "Are you sure you want to delete Testudtræk nr. 2 ?"
        3. Cancel button DA: "Annuller" EN: "Cancel"
        4. Continue button DA: "Fortsæt" EN: "Continue"

Card/tile view

This is the default view.

Holds the users' current analyses in a card view.

It should be dynamic and move the cards/tiles when the browser changes size.

The card should have the following info:

  1. DA: "Navn" EN: "Name"
  2. DA: "Datakilder" EN: "Data sources"
  3. DA: "Periode" EN: "Period"
  4. Vertical options (three dots) that hold:
    1. Copy and delete like in the table view
    2. Edit - DA: "Rediger" EN: "Edit " that opens the analysis
  5. An Edit button on the card with a pencil icon which opens the analysis when clicked on
  6. DA: "Åben" EN: "Open"
    1. an button that allow the user to open and go to the analysis

Common for Table and Card/tile view

When analyses are present in a table or card view, we want to move the part for the user guide to the upper left corner.

In the upper right corner, we want:

  1. Button: Create new analysis (see empty view part)
  2. A button to change between table and card view. This should be two icons
    1. ex:

Developer notes

* We want to investigate if the Visual backend can handle getting an Auth Token (new/angular) instead of a cookie (old/react).
* If it cannot, we should make it possible.
Yes it can: https://brunata.youtrack.cloud/issue/AGI-15335

Team test on DEV failed.

Missing:

  • columns on the batch edit table
    • The table is the same as in the data source view AGI-15141 with some small changes.
    • The filtration for colors has been removed on the datasource table since it didn't make sense. we also don't show the hex color code since the selection has changed to a number of predetermined colors the user can choose from.
  • no view dropdown to change the view of the table
    • There should be pagination, page size, and a view button to select which columns to display.

When I try to batch edit for a certain group of data sources, everything still gets updated.
ex.

","author":{"name":"Mads Rune Frederiksen","login":"mafr","$type":"User"},"deleted":false,"updated":null,"created":1752497767661,"id":"4-112549","$type":"IssueComment"},{"textPreview":"

After a Visual walk through today and a later discussion with Malene and Birgitte, we came up with some changes in relation to the batch edit-flow.

I've created some mockups based on our thoughts. Perhaps we should discuss, if it leads to any questions?

FLOW

Step 1. before the user has chosen what to edit. The fields could be 'greyed' out and the same for the 'Fortsæt'-button, as it's only allowed to continue if one of the check-boxes are ticked off and input validated.

Step 2. When the user has ticked off e.g. 'Vælg om du vil have datakilder vist på graften', the input-field/drop down is now visible/editable. And the 'Fortsæt'-button is now allowing for the user to continue.

Preliminary User test

Even though I've picked meters for my analysis which has the usage 'Cold water' some of them are still not convertable to 'consumption'. I both get the badge in the first part of the 'batch edit'-flow, and I can't detect whether it's something in the backend or something which we need to be able to handle in the frontend? Currently I'm unable to identify why they can't be converted.

Meters which can't be converted to 'consumption'.

As a user of Brunata Online Visual

I want to be able to batch-correct my data sources

So I can work more efficiently

Mockup

https://balsamiq.cloud/sxo5ezq/p2pbllu/rE059

General

The button DA: "Gruppe rettelse" EN: "Batch edit" on the data sources view opens the first modal that shows the following that the user can choose from to batch edit.

It should not be possible to select value = consumption if the meter is not a consumption meter. Show a warning to the user.

Selection modal

The modal should have a close button with a close icon

Title DA: "Gruppe rettelse" EN: "Batch edit"

Text DA: "Vælg de kolonner, du vil batch redigere" EN: "Select the columns that you want to batch edit"

Each of the fields should have a checkbox, so the user can decide what columns they want to change.

the column name of the checkbox should be "Valgt" EN: "Selected"

Editable Fields

Label DA: "Vis på graf" EN: "Show in graph"

  • Dropdown with Yes or No option (could also be radio buttons instead)

Label DA: "Gruppe" EN: "Group"

  • Should be a text input field
  • max limit 100 char

Label DA: "Værdi" EN: "Value"

  • Dropdown with "Måler værdi" EN: "Meter value" or "Forbrug" EN: "Consumption" option (could also be radio buttons instead)

Label DA: "Farve" EN: "Color"

  • Use the color component currently used in the old visual.

Buttons

From there you can either

DA: "Annuller" EN: "Cancel"

  • Closes the modal without saving.

DA: "Fortsæt" EN: "Continue"

  • Take you to the next modal

Find data sources modal

The modal should have a close button with a close icon

Title DA: "Gruppe rettelse" EN: "Batch edit"

Text DA: "Vælg de datakilder, du vil batch redigere" EN: "Select the data sources that you want to batch edit"

Info card

There should be a card over the table displaying how many data sources the user has selected and their chosen choices.

Text: DA: "Du opdatere X datakilder til at bruge:" EN: "You are updating X data sources to use:"

  • The X is how many data sources and should be updated has they add or remove.

Below the text display the options with the fields label name and the value.

Table

The table is the same as in the data source view AGI-15141 with some small changes.

There should be pagination, page size, and a view button to select which columns to display.

Added

A new column called DA: "Valgt" EN: "Selected"

  • Has on top a button DA: "vælg alle" EN: "Add all" that allow the user to select all the data sources currently in the table (that hasn't been filtered out).
  • Each row has a checkbox the user can press to select that data source.

Removed

Options columns should not be present

Altered

The "Show in graph" column data should be DA: "Ja" EN: "Yes" or DA: "Nej" EN: "No" instead of toggles

Buttons

From there you can either

DA: "Tilbage" EN: "Back"

  • Takes the user back to the previous modal

DA: "Annuller" EN: "Cancel"

  • Closes the modal without saving.

DA: "Gem" EN: "Save"

  • Closes and saves the changes.
  • Should also display a box (toast) with either a success or fail
